Chapter 16, Part 4: Praising MahÄyÄna in the First Part
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

The gate of liberation through emptiness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the gate of liberation through signlessness and wishlessness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;

the intrinsic nature of the gate of liberation through emptiness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of the gate of liberation through signlessness and wishlessness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;

the true suchness of the gate of liberation through emptiness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the true suchness of the gate of liberation through signlessness and wishlessness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;

the self-nature of the gate of liberation through emptiness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the self-nature of the gate of liberation through signlessness and wishlessness has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;

The self-characteristics of the gate of emptiness liberation have no coming, no going, and also do not abide; the self-characteristics of the signless, wishless liberations have no coming, no going, and also do not abide.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the gate of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and their intrinsic nature, suchness, essence, and self-characteristics, whether moving or still, cannot be attained.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

The five eyes have no coming, no going, and also do not abide; the six supernormal knowledges have no coming, no going, and also do not abide;ğŸ”½the intrinsic nature of the five eyes has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of the six supernormal knowledges has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;ğŸ”½the suchness of the five eyes has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
the essence of the five eyes has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the essence of the six supernormal knowledges has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
The intrinsic nature of the five eyes does not come, does not go, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of the six supernormal knowledges does not come, does not go, and also does not abide.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
It is because the five eyes, six supernormal knowledges, and their fundamental nature, suchness, essence, and intrinsic nature, whether moving or still, cannot be apprehended.

Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½The ten powers of a buddha do not come, do not go, and also do not abide; the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, omniscience, cognition of the path, and cognition of all aspects do not come, do not go, and also do not abide;

the fundamental nature of the ten powers of a buddha does not come, does not go, and also does not abide; the fundamental nature of the four fearlessnesses up to the cognition of all aspects does not come, does not go, and also does not abide;

The true nature of the ten powers of the Buddha does not come or go, and also does not abide; the true nature of the four fearlessnesses up to the knowledge of all aspects does not come or go, and also does not abide;ğŸ”½the intrinsic nature of the ten powers of the Buddha does not come or go, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of the four fearlessnesses up to the knowledge of all aspects does not come or go, and also does not abide;

the specific characteristics of the ten powers of the Buddha do not come or go, and also do not abide; the specific characteristics of the four fearlessnesses up to the knowledge of all aspects do not come or go, and also do not abide.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!

Because the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, knowledge of path aspects, knowledge of all aspects, and their intrinsic nature, true nature, intrinsic essence, and specific characteristics, whether moving or still, cannot be apprehended.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
Bodhisattvas have no coming or going, and also do not abide; enlightenment and buddhahood have no coming or going, and also do not abide;
the essential nature of bodhisattvas has no coming or going, and also does not abide; the essential nature of enlightenment and buddhahood has no coming or going, and also does not abide;

the suchness of bodhisattvas has no coming or going, and also does not abide; the suchness of enlightenment and buddhahood has no coming or going, and also does not abide;ğŸ”½the intrinsic nature of bodhisattvas has no coming or going, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of enlightenment and buddhahood has no coming or going, and also does not abide;

the individual characteristics of bodhisattvas have no coming or going, and also do not abide; the individual characteristics of enlightenment and buddhahood have no coming or going, and also do not abide.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
It is because bodhisattvas, enlightenment, buddhahood, their essential nature, suchness, intrinsic nature, and individual characteristics, whether moving or still, cannot be apprehended.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
The conditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the unconditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
The essential nature of the conditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the essential nature of the unconditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
The suchness of the conditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the suchness of the unconditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
The intrinsic nature of the conditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide; the intrinsic nature of the unconditioned has no coming, no going, and also does not abide;
The intrinsic characteristics of the conditioned have no coming, no going, and also do not abide; the intrinsic characteristics of the unconditioned have no coming, no going, and also do not abide.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
It is because the conditioned, the unconditioned, and their essential nature, suchness, intrinsic nature, and intrinsic characteristics, whether moving or still, cannot be apprehended.
SubhÅ«ti!
Therefore, the Great Vehicle is said to have no coming, no going, and no abiding to be seen, just like space.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

You say, 'Again, just as the beginning, end, and middle cannot be attained in empty space, the same is so with the Great Vehicle. The beginning, end, and middle cannot be attained because the three times are equal, and it is called the Great Vehicle.'ğŸ”½This is so!
This is so!
As you have said.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!

The past time is empty of the past time, the future time is empty of the future time, the present time is empty of the present time, the nature of the equality of the three times is empty of the nature of the equality of the three times, the nature of the Great Vehicle is empty of the nature of the Great Vehicle, and the nature of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas is empty of the nature of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
Emptiness has no characteristics of one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, or ten differences. Therefore, the Great Vehicle is equal in the three times.
SubhÅ«ti!
In this Great Vehicle, the characteristics of equality and inequality, greed and non-greed,
The characteristics of anger and non-anger are both unobtainable, the characteristics of delusion and non-delusion are bothğŸ”½unobtainable,

The characteristics of anger and non-anger are both unobtainable, the characteristics of delusion and non-delusion are both unobtainable, the characteristics of pride and non-pride are both unobtainable, and so forth up to the characteristics of good and non-good
are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the determinate and the indeterminate are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the contaminated and the uncontaminated
are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the sinful and the sinless are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the defiled and the undefiled
are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the mundane and the supramundane are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the defiled and the pure
are both unobtainable, the characteristics of birth and death and nirvana are both unobtainable, the characteristics of permanence and impermanence

are both unobtainable, the characteristics of happiness and suffering are both unobtainable, the characteristics of self and non-self are both unobtainable, the characteristics of purity and impurity are both unobtainable, the characteristics of tranquility and agitation are both unobtainable, the characteristics of abandonment and non-abandonment are both unobtainable, the characteristics of the desire realm and transcending the desire realm
The characteristics of the form realm cannot be obtained apart from the characteristics of the form realm, and the characteristics of the formless realm
cannot be obtained apart from the characteristics of the formless realm.
Why is this?
SubhÅ«ti!
It is because in the Great Vehicle the intrinsic nature of dharmas cannot be obtained.
SubhÅ«ti!
Past form is empty of past form, future form is empty of future form, present form is empty of present form;

Past feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are empty of past feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, future feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are empty of future feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, present feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are empty of present feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.
Why is this?
SubhÅ«ti!
In emptiness, past form cannot be obtained.
Why is this?
Past form is precisely emptiness, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. Emptiness within emptiness cannot even be apprehended, let alone past form being apprehended within emptiness.
SubhÅ«ti!
Form in the future cannot be apprehended within emptiness.
Why is it so?

Form in the future is precisely emptiness, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. Emptiness within emptiness cannot even be apprehended, let alone form in the future being apprehended within emptiness.
SubhÅ«ti!
Form in the present cannot be apprehended within emptiness.

Form in the present is precisely emptiness, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. Emptiness within emptiness cannot even be apprehended, let alone form in the present being apprehended within emptiness.

Past feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are themselves empty, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. In emptiness, emptiness itself cannot be apprehended, let alone the existence of past feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness in emptiness.

Future feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are themselves empty, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. In emptiness, emptiness itself cannot be apprehended, let alone the existence of future feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness in emptiness.

Present feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are themselves empty, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. Emptiness within emptiness cannot even be apprehended, let alone the possibility of apprehending present feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness within emptiness.
SubhÅ«ti!
In emptiness, past, future, and present feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness cannot be apprehended.

Past, future, and present feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are themselves empty, and the nature of emptiness is also empty. Emptiness within emptiness cannot even be apprehended, let alone the possibility of apprehending past, future, and present feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness within emptiness.
